intro: Diosma glabrata, commonly known as the smooth diosma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. Diosma glabrata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
